posts.body:
>>f49dacd4-6552-4efa-8272-9ae4af33c737
>>0d4e89c5-dd5e-435e-a18f-c62a0d505cbd

Just like all the other places we tried to migrate to for a temporary haven, nobody ever said or thought this was done by CM.

I totally agree that this concept scares them because they have no control over it, and while I was skeptical at first, the more I think about it, the more it makes sense until something better is available.

PLUS, and this is huge, we were told over and over to archive OFFLINE.  Who did that???  Very fucking few.  Archive sites sprang up, and very useful & appreciated ones at that, but still not saved offline.  This site does that automatcally for every one of us.  Every peer has a copy of the text and the pics they viewed/seeded, and it can all be reviewed without a connection to the net.  They can't shut us all down...

As for the evil/bad content, MUTE it, and it will remove it from your machine...

>>7a7c3660-c253-48e1-8768-c2c1ad05da38
It's not in /pol/
It's in /bant/ in Q Research General #9409 here:
http://boards.4chan.org/bant/thread/8510372#p8510921

Hovering over the ID YClmReyM says "1 post by this ID"

>>144d1bbe-b025-4acd-9d02-71439f8db8c7
So how to find Q...  WWG1WGA.
Searched pol for that and found an archive thread from earlier with no content, but this pic named endchan.png saying:

Read between the lines
BLOCKADE END
GOOD TO GO.
Q

>>c7303c69-0c6c-4b96-b6d6-f7f65d5611eb
What risk?  There's no more risk here than anywhere else, and likely less.  You can manage what is stored if you start looking in the data directory.  You can even identify an equivalent of an ID to tie a particular user's posts together (at least until a key change is made).

Zero has pluses:
Can't be DDOS'd because there's no central site to attack, and it doesn't need DNS which would be another attack surface.

Text is archived automatically by virtue of the P2P structure.

I don't buy into "pressure" of any kind.  Period.  Anons do what anons want.  As long as we cross post across the various bunkers, all is good.

If there's a Q sighting, word will spread...

OMG Fear is such an amazing & scary thing.  It has more power than anything (well almost).

That hash is basically the equivalent of the ID in 8chan except that it lasts until you change it instead of changing each bread/thread.

So what.

It's actually useful, and what would be nice is a mod that would show it on the board with each post so we can see easily which replies are posted by the same ID.  (We can look now in the data/1DdPHedr.../data/users/*/data.json file to see all posts by an ID.)

Changing it is kind of equivalent to changing your IP (change vpn server) on 8chan to force a new ID except that it's now much easier to change here if/when needed.  Only shills had an (obvious) need to do that.

Unless you have a reason to not want your multiple posts connected to the same user ID, then relax.

Million dollar question:
Why would the shills want you to change it with every post?????  And why do they?????

Easy - because the filtering is by ID.  So if everyone changed their ID every time, no filtering would have any affect anymore.

We can be sent down path after path after path for all the wrong reasons...

God bless patriots.  Pray...
